newsitem.title: USA: Parametric Q3 results hurt by Japan sales.
newsitem.headline: Parametric Q3 results hurt by Japan sales.

text.p: Parametric Technology Corp said Thursday slow sales in Japan and a strengthening U.S. dollar hurt its revenue growth in the quarter ended June 28.
The company reported earnings of $0.42 a share on revenues of $207.1 million in the quarter, compared with $0.31 a share on revenues of $157.1 million the year before.

Chief executive Steven Walske said in a statement slow sales in Japan and the U.S. dollar's strenght versus the Japanese yen hampered third-quarter overall revenue growth. He added the company put new management in place in Japan to strenghten its sales force.
Walske also said the company shipped 7,611 software units in the last quarter, increasing the total to 93,601 units installed globally.
Parametric makes software used to automate mechanical product development.
